Description: Rim sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; discoloured white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; on right, faded outline of lotus flower in added white; below, trace of one white band; exterior: short diagonal stroke frieze at rim, above possible maeander pattern; below, painted decoration consisting of sphinx or siren (only forehead, eye and nose remaining), to right, facing griffin to left (beak and tongue preserved); pendant triangle and part of rosette as filling ornament; inscription on interior.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 254, no. 437)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0572) (phase 2)
